titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. James Anderson, Judgment
CWG9755

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
State of Ky.
Montgomery circuit court
The Commonwealth
vs } Murder Judgment.
James Anderson

The Deft. James Anderson was this day brought into court, and was asked if he had any thing to say why sentence Should not be pronounced, and saying nothing. It was adjudged by the court that James Anderson be now remanded to the Jail of this county. there to remain until next monday the 27th of the present month. And from thence on that day be taken by the Sheriff of this county to the State penetentiary, and be there confined at hard labor for the period of two years.

A true copy
Att. J. M. Crawford clerk
Montgomery circuit court.
